message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The history of recurrent infections, especially pneumonia, suggests that the patient may have an underlying immunodeficiency. Among the options, only tyrosine kinase gene mutation can cause immunodeficiency and recurrent infections. Defective NADPH oxidase causes chronic granulomatous disease, defective IL-2R gamma chain causes X-linked severe combined immunodeficiency, and WAS gene mutation causes Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s recurrent infections suggest an underlying immunodeficiency disorder. Among the options, only tyrosine kinase gene mutation is associated with primary immunodeficiency disorders that lead to recurrent respiratory infections. Defective NADPH oxidase is associated with chronic granulomatous disease, Defective IL-2R gamma chain is associated with X-linked severe combined immunodeficiency, and WAS gene mutation is associated with Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s recurrent respiratory infections and otitis media suggest a primary immune deficiency. Among the options, only a tyrosine kinase gene mutation is associated with primary immune deficiency, specifically X-linked agammaglobulinemia (XLA). This is characterized by a lack of B cells and reduced levels of immunoglobulin. The hypoplastic tonsils and adenoids also support this diagnosis. Defective NADPH oxidase is associated with chronic granulomatous disease, defective IL-2R gamma chain is associated with X-linked severe combined immunodeficiency, and WAS gene mutation is associated with Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, none of which fit the patient’s presentation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Recurrent pneumonia and otitis media in a young child could suggest an underlying immunodeficiency. Among the options, only a tyrosine kinase gene mutation is associated with immunodeficiency and recurrent infections.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's recurrent respiratory tract infections and hospitalizations suggest a primary immunodeficiency disorder. Among the options, only a tyrosine kinase gene mutation can cause recurrent respiratory infections, otitis media, and pneumonia along with hypoplastic tonsils and adenoids. Defective NADPH oxidase will cause chronic granulomatous disease, Defective IL-2R gamma chain will cause X-linked severe combined immunodeficiency, and WAS gene mutation will cause Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with recurrent respiratory infections and otitis media, and the tonsils and adenoids are hypoplastic. These are all symptoms of a primary immunodeficiency disorder. Among the options, only a tyrosine kinase gene mutation is associated with primary immunodeficiency disorders.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s history of recurrent pneumonia, otitis media, and respiratory tract infections suggests an immunodeficiency disorder. Among the options, only tyrosine kinase gene mutation can cause immunodeficiency and recurrent infections. Defective NADPH oxidase causes chronic granulomatous disease, Defective IL-2R gamma chain causes X-linked severe combined immunodeficiency, and WAS gene mutation causes Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest a primary immunodeficiency disorder, and among the options, only a tyrosine kinase gene mutation can cause recurrent respiratory tract infections, otitis media, hypoplastic tonsils and adenoids, and fatigue. Defective NADPH oxidase causes chronic granulomatous disease, while defective IL-2R gamma chain and WAS gene mutation cause severe combined immunodeficiency syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has a history of recurrent respiratory tract infections and pneumonia, suggesting an underlying immunodeficiency. Among the options, only a tyrosine kinase gene mutation is associated with immunodeficiency and recurrent respiratory infections. Defective NADPH oxidase causes chronic granulomatous disease, defective IL-2R gamma chain causes X-linked severe combined immunodeficiency, and WAS gene mutation causes Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, all of which may present with recurrent infections but not specifically respiratory tract infections and pneumonia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s recurrent respiratory tract infections, otitis media, and pneumonia suggest an underlying immune deficiency, specifically a primary immunodeficiency. Among the options, only a tyrosine kinase gene mutation is associated with primary immunodeficiencies, specifically X-linked agammaglobulinemia. Defective NADPH oxidase, defective IL-2R gamma chain, and WAS gene mutations are associated with other types of primary immunodeficiencies.
